sentence.idiomatic: Every child has an abundance of imagination.
When I hear this song, I usually will think of how things were when I was young.
When you see this picture, what do you associate it with?
Yesterday I got 100 percent on my test, but the teacher didn't give me any kind of reward.

word.literal: to pass a placement exam for

sentence.idiomatic: Last year when I passed the university entrance exam, mom rewarded me with a computer.
Whoever guesses the name of the movie will get the reward.
I've heard that a lot of people go to that temple to burn incense.
Lately my luck hasn't been good. I need to go burn some incense and turn my luck around.
Every time before I have an exam I go to the temple to burn incense to seek a blessing to pass.

word.literal: to pray to Buddha for help

sentence.idiomatic: After her child fell ill, she went everywhere, appealing to Buddha to bless her child with peace.

word.literal: to pray to Buddha for help

sentence.idiomatic: Whenever she has any minor problem, she always appeals to Buddha for help.
Only through hard work can you succeed. It's useless to rely on appeals to Buddha.
Parents can't do everything. There are things they can't do.
The government is not omnipotent. It also runs into problems it can't solve.
Omnipotent God, please bless us.
No money is not a problem. No friends is absolutely unacceptable.
Leaving a two year-old child alone at home is absolutely unacceptable.
What never occurred to her is that her best friend stole her boyfriend.
He's not in very good form today; he missed several excellent opportunities for goals.
After warming up, he's already in game mode.
Currently the population of many countries is already in an aged state.
Today I'm going to test your free associations.
What?
I'll say a word, and you just tell me what you associate it with. Relax completely. Just say whatever comes to mind.
OK.
Are you ready?
Yes. Let's start.
Bun.
Cafeteria. The meat buns at my dad's work unit cafeteria were the best. When I was little, if I got a good test score, Dad would buy a meat bun to reward me.
Did you eat them often?
No, my grades weren't good.
Let's try another one. Temple.

word.literal: to appeal to Buddha for help

sentence.idiomatic: Bad-smelling. The smell of burning incense is the worst. I just don't get why so many people pray to Buddha for help.
You don't believe in religion?
I only believe in what I can see and touch, like buns and money.
What does money make you think of?
Happiness and sorrow. Although money can't do everything, without it you can't do anything.
How about red? What does that make you think of?
Firecrackers.
And blue?
Blue? The ocean. But I don't like the ocean.
OK, let's just stop here today.
It's over? Just when I was getting into it. How about this: next time it's my turn to test you.

word.literal: to appeal to Buddha for help
